metadata.Title: CVE-2018-14734 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
drivers/infiniband/core/ucma.c in the Linux kernel through 4.17.11 allows ucma_leave_multicast to access a certain data structure after a cleanup step in ucma_process_join, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service (use-after-free). Noam Rathaus discovered that a use-after-free vulnerability existed in the Infiniband implementation in the Linux kernel. An attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14734` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:
